result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger W Fechner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution is held open pending further determination.  State to submit all documentation, receipts and any other information to the defense, in writing, within 60 days.  If restitution issue is not stipulated to, the Court will schedule a restitution hearing.

02/12/2016 AMENDED: COURT ORDERS RESTITUTION BE SET AT $0.00.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Court orders indeterminate amount of incarceration in prison not to exceed 40 years.

CORRECTED 12/14/15 TO REFLECT 40 YEARS IN THE LENGTH COLUMN.
Consecutive to: Any sentence currently serving in Washburn County or any other county.

Must have no contact with any of the victims or their families.
Must have no contact with minor children under the age of 18.
Must report as a sex offender for the rest of his natural life.
